core.tables

Class BaseTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.tables.BaseTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Row>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseGeneratedTable, ListTable

    public abstract class BaseTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Row>
    The Class BaseTable represents the most general type of table that the loose solver can use. This wants to be an interface, in fact it isn't a fully usable class but has abstract methods that every implementation must provide. It's an abstract class so we can also write some default method implementation in order not to have to write it in every single implementation if we just want the default behavior. It's an iterable or Row, so with the method iterator() we can obtain an iterator over all the rows of the table.

      <F> java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> toIndices(java.util.List<F> fragment)
      Takes a List of Object, they can be Integer or String (checkd by attributes.toIndices) and returns a List of integers, if the input was a List it will be returned as is, if there are strings in the input list, they will be searched in the attributes and they will be converted to the appropriate index.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> toNames(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> indices)
      Takes a List of Object, they can be Integer or String (checkd by attributes.toNames) and returns a List of strings, if the input was a List it will be returned as is, if there are integers in the input list, they will be used to index the attributes and they will be converted as names.
